channel.title: Scranton Herald News Feed
channel.description: The best news source in all of Scranton

item.title: Robert Mueller may be poised to lift the lid of his investigation
item.description: Murica may get its most intimate look yet inside Robert Mueller's secretive Russia investigation in the next four days, with a series of disclosures that have the potential to be greatly damaging...

item.title: Tornado in northeastern Pennsylvania causes severe damage
item.description: Forecasters confirm a tornado caused severe damage in northeastern Pennsylvania Wednesday night. The storm that ripped through the Scranton area was so powerful it overturned...

item.title: Man dies after truck goes into Lake Scranton
item.description:
ROARING BROOK TOWNSHIP, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) - A 59-year-old man is dead after his pick-up truck went into Lake Scranton.

Dozens of emergency responders, including...

item.title: Scranton man charged in pursuit through Wilkes-Barre, Hanover Township
item.description:
A Scranton man was arraigned Friday on charges he initiated a high-speed pursuit that began in Wilkes-Barre and ended when he abandoned the vehicle on a dirt road in Hanover Township.

State...

item.title: Wealthy Teen Nearly Experiences Consequence
item.description: In what local authorities are calling a "near tragedy," Charles Wentworth, a 17-year-old Rutgers Preparatory senior and member of the affluent Wentworth family, came perilously close to suffering a...

item.title: Shawn Christy captured in Ohio
item.description: Shawn Christy, the fugutive from McAdoo who was wanted for allegedly threatening President Trump, has been apprehended in Ohio. He was arrested at 4:45pm Friday in Mifflin Township Ohio by U.S...

item.title: C-SPAN Bus Coming to University of Scranton
item.description: The new C-SPAN bus will visit The University of Scranton as part of its 50 Capitals Tour on Friday, Oct. 5, from 9 a.m. to noon. The C-SPAN bus is an interactive multi-media learning center focused...

item.title: CIA Realizes It's Been Using Black Highlighters All These Years
item.description: A report released Tuesday by the CIA's Office of the Inspector General revealed that the CIA has mistakenly obscured hundreds of thousands of pages of critical intelligence information with black...

item.title: Coroner seeking family of man struck and killed while crossing street
item.description: The Lackawanna County coroner is asking the public for help to find the next of kin of a man who has recently died.

item.title: The Battle of Schrute Farms Lie!
item.description: The Battle of Schrute Farms was a codename for a gathering of artists and poets during the Civil War. After tracking down a historian, Oscar Martinez learn that the Battle of Schrute Farms did in fact...

item.title: Scranton Strangler Strikes Again
item.description:
An elderly widow who lived alone was found strangled Tuesday night in her east Scranton apartment.
Nulla pulvinar dictum orci, in mattis eros volutpat sit amet. Integer id massa nulla. Curabitur...

item.description: Michael G. Scott, Regional Manager at Dunder Mifflin, is a modest guy who likes to wear jeans, cherishes his "World's Best Boss" mug, and lacks a college...

item.title: Scranton Area Paper Company Dunder Mifflin Apologizes to Valued Client
item.description: Dunder Mifflin Paper Products was thrust into damage control early Thursday morning as the company reported that 500 cases of 24lb cream letter stock paper had been shipped with an obscene watermark...
